#Text=Istanbul court acquits bomb accused Pinar Selek for fourth time
#Text=Saturday , December 20 , 2014
#Text=A court in the Turkish capital Istanbul yesterday cleared exiled academic Pinar Selek of killing seven in a bomb attack in 1998 .
#Text=It is the fourth time the courts have cleared her .
#Text=File photo of Selek .
#Text=Image : Streetpepper .
#Text=Forensic investigators blamed the explosion , which also injured 127 , in the city 's Spice Bazaar on an inadvertent gas leak .
#Text=Selek was arrested two days after the explosion .
#Text=She spent two years in prison but has been acquitted at each of three trials .
#Text=Following exonerations in 2006 and 2008 she headed to Europe .
#Text=Initially travelling to Germany , Selek , now 43 , then headed to France .
#Text=She is a researcher at the University of Lyon .
#Text=She resides in Strasbourg and is involved with feminist activism .
#Text=Selek specialises in the Kurdish people .
#Text=In
#Text=addition to the bombing , Selek was accused of aiding Kurdistan Workers ' Party ( PKK ) militancy .
#Text=She has been free since the 2000 publication of a report rejecting the bombing claim in favour of a gas leak .
#Text=Another acquittal came in 2011 .
#Text=That was set aside the following year and in January 2013 a conviction was substituted with a life sentence .
#Text=The sentence followed a conviction in which chief judge Vedat Yılmazabdurrahmanoğlu indicated he did not accept the evidence proved a bombing but was outvoted by two fellow judges .
#Text=That sentence was cancelled in June this year by the Supreme Court of Appeals .
#Text=A warrant for her arrest was cancelled in October .
#Text=Turkey had previously sought extradition from France .
#Text=We have been waiting in front of courtrooms for sixteen years — Selek supporter and activist Füsun Demirel
#Text=Selek has also refused to identify to police rebels met in the course of research .

#Text=Defence lawyer Akın Atalay had submitted the evidence did not prove a bombing had occurred , and that the repeated prosecutions violate Turkish and international fair trial standards prohibiting double jeopardy .
#Text=He was countered by Istanbul public prosecutor Yılmaz Kıstı who earlier this month sought a new life sentence in the case .
#Text=The case has attracted supporters of Selek in Turkey and France .
#Text=They claim the prosecution is politically motivated to prevent her from conducting sociological research .
#Text=At the start of the appeal in April this year
#Text=Turkish and French protestors gathered outside the Çağlayan Courthouse , waving banners demanding " Justice for Pinar Selek " .

column1: #Text=Protestors were there on December 5 when the request for a new life sentence was made .
#Text=" We have been waiting in front of courtrooms for sixteen years " , activist Füsun Demirel told journalists at the protest .
#Text=" Pınar has resisted this ruthlessness , this injustice , by trying to live as fully as she can . "
#Text=Also acquitted yesterday was Abdulmecit Ozturk .
#Text=The court said there was no " exact and convincing " evidence against the pair .
#Text=Selek has indicated a desire to return to Turkey with her name cleared .
#Text=" We will be standing guard on her behalf until she returns here " , Demriel promised at the December 5 protest .
